This weekend, NYC, NJ, and CT are bracing for a winter storm, while traffic disruptions are reported on the George Washington Bridge and a deadly crash raises concerns about sanitation operations. Additionally, Mayor Mamdani proposes cuts to library funding and plans to close the last emergency migrant shelter by year-end.

### Risks & Alerts

- Winter storm forecast predicts snow this weekend in NYC, NJ, and CT. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- Investigation underway into whether Sanitation Department snow operations contributed to recent deadly crash on LIE. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- Lanes closed on George Washington Bridge due to ongoing construction. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- Dense fog and air quality advisories in effect across NYC area, with rain expected soon. [↗](https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMinwFBVV95cUxNQW9XbEZuclpaR3ktb2NUNGFNQjNkWVdLV29OQ3hHSHZneVEyaHQyT1NBNWV2M1JmQ3JMZ3hxeW1TSlBNeXl4dllFN0ZLYU5JeXlRNU5IeU5BQXlMLUJtdVlCZElKZFIwTjZnN2c3UUtOT0c4X2FxbUdEZzFfZFFpcmY4SFpEbkVTeGdhV0JqeTFrMklOODhWVlBYSEJxdVk?oc=5)
